title: hand drawn script (not BRUSH SCRIPT!!)
content:
Hi all

I’m looking for a hand drawn script to use for a title called ’Your Time’

Can anyone suggest a font rather than have it commissioned??

Freestyle script is the best I’ve tried so far

Thanks!

 [‹ Big ITC Baskerville?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025042256/http:/typophile.com/node/40170 "Go to previous forum topic") [Book Design Typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025042256/http:/typophile.com/node/40148 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dendicott

comments.content:
Lots of great stuff available:  
Check out the [Casual Scripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025042256/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?search=action&keywords=scriptscasual&template=Templates/Category.html) at Font Bros  
Check out the [Formal Scrips](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025042256/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?search=action&keywords=scriptsformal&template=Templates/Category.html&sortkey=order&sortorder=descending&sortby=recent) at Font Bros

I used this recently.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/lily-wang/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025042256/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/lily-wang/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/lily-wang/")

Not a clean font, but if you don’t have much to set you can fix it up a bit.
